input: Welcome back to Lockdown Math!
translatedText: 欢迎回到锁定数学！

input: Today we are going to be talking about Euler's formula.
translatedText: 今天我们要讲的是欧拉公式。

input: And just to give you a little sense of where we're going to be ending up with this lesson, I'm going to go ahead and show you what we're aiming for at the end, which is a certain visualization.
translatedText: 为了让您对本课的结束有一点了解，我将继续 向您展示我们最后的目标，即某种可视化。

input: So, I don't expect you to necessarily understand this immediately, but the point is that this is something we're going to walk towards.
translatedText: 所以，我并不指望你一定能立即理解这一点 ，但重点是这是我们将要努力实现的目标。

input: What we're going to analyze is an extension of the idea of exponentials in a way that works in the complex plane.
translatedText: 我们要分析的是指数概念在复平面上的扩展。

input: And the illustration that you're looking at is showing very literally what the claim of Euler's formula is.
translatedText: 您所看到的插图非常字面地显示了欧拉公式的主张。

input: Because what I want you to appreciate is what the actual statement says, rather than letting it be shrouded in a certain mystery or a certain question of what the conventions are.
translatedText: 因为我想让你欣赏的是实际的陈述所说的内容，而不 是让它被某种神秘感或某种约定俗成的问题所笼罩。

input: Now, needless to say, this is kind of a confusing thing.
translatedText: 现在，不用说，这是一件令人困惑的事情。

input: We've got this spiral of vectors, and if it's not entirely clear, don't worry about it.
translatedText: 我们已经得到了向量的螺旋，如果它不完全清楚，请不要担心。

input: I just want to give you a little sense of where we're going to be going with this.
translatedText: 我只是想让您了解一下我们将如何处理这件事。

input: But before any of that, let's take a step back and remember where were we.
translatedText: 但在此之前，让我们退后一步，记住我们在哪里。

input: Back in the end of the last lesson, when we were talking about complex numbers, one of the key types of complex numbers that we were looking at were those that existed on the unit circle.
translatedText: 回到上一课的末尾，当我们讨论复数时，我们所关注 的复数的关键类型之一是存在于单位圆上的复数。

input: So here I have a little complex plane drawn.
translatedText: 所以这里我画了一个复杂的平面。

input: We've got the real number line with the points 1 and negative 1 indicated.
translatedText: 我们已经得到了实数轴，其中标出了点 1 和负 1。

input: We've got the imaginary number line, i being the square root of negative 1.
translatedText: 我们得到了虚数轴，i 是负 1 的平方根。

input: And if you remember, one of the main points that we emphasized last time is that when you have a number who's sitting one unit away from the origin at some angle theta, multiplying by this number has the effect of rotating things by that angle.
translatedText: 如果你还记得的话，我们上次强调的要点之一是，当你有一个数字与原点以某个角度 theta 相距一个单位时，乘以这个数字就会产生将物体旋转该角度的效果。

input: This is incredibly important throughout physics, throughout electrical engineering, all throughout math.
translatedText: 这在整个物理学、整个电气工程、整个数学中都非常重要。

input: You see these numbers everywhere.
translatedText: 你到处都可以看到这些数字。

input: They describe wave mechanics, they're very important for polynomials.
translatedText: 它们描述了波力学，对于多项式非常重要。

input: It's really hard to overstate how important numbers that sit on this unit circle are.
translatedText: 这个单位圆上的数字的重要性怎么强调都不为过。

input: Now one way that you could write them is with the real and imaginary parts.
translatedText: 现在，编写它们的一种方法是使用实部和虚部。

input: And based on lecture 2, if we know our trigonometry, the x coordinate is going to be the cosine of that angle, and the y coordinate, which is the imaginary part, is going to be i times the sine of that angle.
translatedText: 根据第 2 讲，如果我们知道三角学，则 x 坐标将是该角度 的余弦，而 y 坐标（即虚部）将是该角度的 i 倍正弦。

input: So you might think, all throughout physics, all throughout electrical engineering, you see the expression cosine of theta plus i sine of theta.
translatedText: 所以你可能会想，在整个物理学、整个电气工程中，你都会看到表达式 cosine of theta plus i sine of theta。

input: In fact, what you often see is another form of this.
translatedText: 事实上，你经常看到的是另一种形式。

input: Almost always, you see this written down as e to the power i times theta.
translatedText: 几乎总是，你会看到它写成 e 的 i 次方乘以 theta。

input: And this relationship is what's known as Euler's formula.
translatedText: 这种关系就是所谓的欧拉公式。

input: Now e is a special constant of nature, and I always remember in high school, it was never crystal clear to me exactly what it was.
translatedText: 现在，e 是一个特殊的自然常数，我一直记得在高中时，我从来都不清楚它到底是什么。

input: It was something that was just kind of handed down, okay, it's 2.
translatedText: 这是一种传承下来的东西，好吧，是 2。

input: 71828, on and on.
And we were just taking, you know, we were to take this as an analog of pi.
translatedText: 我们只是将其视为 pi 的类比。

input: It's an irrational number that evidently the universe finds significant.
translatedText: 这是一个显然对宇宙来说很重要的无理数。

input: I had one calculus teacher who would tell us it was the Andrew Jackson number, because the president, Andrew Jackson, served two terms.
translatedText: 我有一位微积分老师，他会告诉我们这是安德鲁·杰克逊数，因为总统安德鲁·杰克逊担任了两届任期。

input: He was the seventh president, and he was elected in 1828.
translatedText: 他是第七任总统，于 1828 年当选。

input: So, there you go.
translatedText: 那么，就这样吧。

input: I don't know if Andrew Jackson appreciated this relationship that he had to Euler, but it always helped me remember the number.
translatedText: 我不知道安德鲁·杰克逊是否欣赏他与欧拉的这种关系，但这总是帮助我记住这个数字。

input: Now, just to gauge sentiment, because I'm not entirely sure where the audience is, I want to know what your current relationship with this particular formula is.
translatedText: 现在，只是为了衡量情绪，因为我不完全确定观众在哪里，我想知道您当前与这个特定公式的关系是什么。

input: So we're going to do a poll to start, and this poll is mostly going to be helpful to me.
translatedText: 因此，我们将首先进行一项民意调查，这项民意调查主要对我有帮助。

input: So, polling up some of the warm-up questions that we had, where evidently most of you, if you were to choose one of Euler's formulas, would have gone with the one that we're talking about today, which is great, you know, appropriate given where we want to head.
translatedText: 因此，对我们提出的一些热身问题进行民意调查，显然，如果你们要选择欧拉公式之一，你们中的大多数人都会选择我们今天讨论的公式，这很棒，你们知道，考虑到我们想要去的地方，这是适当的。

input: As a poll that's actually going to be helpful to me, let me ask you, which of the following best describes your relationship with the formula e to the power i theta equals cosine of theta plus i times the sine of theta?
translatedText: 作为一项实际上对我有帮助的民意调查，让我问你，以下哪一项最能描述你与公式 e 的关系：i theta 的幂等于 theta 的余弦加 i 乘以 theta 的正弦？

input: Okay?
translatedText: 好的？

input: And the options here are that you've never seen it before, totally understandable, that you've seen it but you're confused by it, that you still don't understand it but you've grown used to it, or that you understand it well.
translatedText: 这里的选项是，你以前从未见过它，完全可以理解，你已经见过它，但你对它感到困惑，你仍然不明白它，但你已经习惯了它，或者你很明白。

input: So, as you can see, answers are rolling in.
translatedText: 所以，正如你所看到的，答案正在滚滚而来。

input: Please participate!
This is going to be way fun if more of you participate.
translatedText: 请参加！ 如果更多人参与的话，这会很有趣。

input: You can go to 3b1b.
translatedText: 你可以去3b1b。

input: co slash live, link is also in the description, that forwards you to the place where you can answer this poll.
translatedText: co斜线直播，链接也在描述中，将您转发到可以回答此民意调查的地方。

input: And while answers are rolling in, I just want to remind us of a more famous variant of this expression that you often see, which is basically what happens when you plug in pi.
translatedText: 虽然答案不断涌现，但我只是想提醒我们这个表达式的一个更著名的变体，您经常看到，这基本上就是当您插入 pi 时会发生的情况。

input: Okay, so, if we say e to the i times pi, now we're thinking of pi as an angle, it's a number of radians, a distance around the unit circle, you would plug in cosine of pi plus i times the sine of pi.
translatedText: 好的，所以，如果我们对 i 乘以 pi 说 e，现在我们将 pi 视为一个角度，它是弧度数，是单位圆周围的距离，您可以代入 pi 的余弦加上 i 乘以正弦圆周率。

input: Okay?
translatedText: 好的？

input: And the way to think about that is to look at the unit circle and ask, what if you walked around until you'd walked a total distance of pi?
translatedText: 思考这个问题的方法是看着单位圆并问，如果你一直走直到走完 pi 的总距离怎么办？

input: You know, if it's a lake with a radius 1 and you walk around the boundary until you've gone a distance of pi, kind of by the definition of what pi is, that takes you halfway around the circle.
translatedText: 你知道，如果这是一个半径为 1 的湖，你绕着边界走，直到你走了 pi 的距离（根据 pi 的定义），你就绕了半圈。

input: So the x component, cosine, is going to be negative 1, and then the y component, sine, is actually 0, so there's no imaginary part, it's just negative 1.
translatedText: 所以 x 分量余弦将为负 1，然后 y 分量正弦实际上为 0，因此没有虚部，只是负 1。

input: And this gets us, you know, what might be the most celebrity equation in all of math, e to the i times pi is equal to negative 1.
translatedText: 这让我们知道，什么可能是所有数学中最著名的方程，e 乘以 pi 等于负 1。

input: Okay?
translatedText: 好的？

input: But it's baffling, genuinely baffling, because you've got this idea of raising a constant, which is a little wishy-washy to start with, what is e, but you're raising it to an imaginary power.
translatedText: 但这令人费解，真正令人费解，因为你有这样的想法：提高一个常数，这在一开始有点软弱，e 是什么，但你正在将它提高到一个虚数幂。

input: And if you don't understand what that means, you're in good company, I think very few people in the world actually do.
translatedText: 如果你不明白这意味着什么，那么你的同伴很好，我认为世界上很少有人真正明白。

input: Now turning back to our poll, where we've got a good number of responses, and a pretty good spread too, I'm genuinely curious to know, who am I talking to right now?
translatedText: 现在回到我们的民意调查，我们得到了大量的回应，而且传播范围也相当大，我真的很想知道，我现在在和谁说话？

input: Okay?
translatedText: 好的？

input: Because it looks like we have a pretty even distribution among all camps.
translatedText: 因为看起来我们在所有阵营中的分布相当均匀。

input: Alright, so the number one most common answer is c, which is those who still don't understand it but they've grown used to it.
translatedText: 好吧，所以最常见的第一个答案是 c，这是那些仍然不理解但已经习惯的人。

input: This, I'm going to guess, includes people like math majors or engineering majors or people who have gone into a technical field, where it comes up a lot, so you have to grow used to it.
translatedText: 我猜，这包括数学专业或工程专业的人，或者进入技术领域的人，这些领域经常出现，所以你必须习惯它。

input: This is also revealing the fact that even though these lectures are targeted at high school students, that this channel has a certain base demographic to start with, so sometimes those sitting in the audience, it's more like adults who have walked in and are sitting in the back of the class.
translatedText: 这也揭示了一个事实，即使这些讲座是针对高中生的，但这个频道有一定的基础人群，所以有时坐在观众席上的人，更像是走进来坐在里面的成年人。 班级的后面。

input: Very happy to see that d, I understand it well, is the second most common answer.
translatedText: 很高兴看到 d，我很好理解，是第二个最常见的答案。

input: I'm curious among those who answer d, if by the end of the lecture they would say that what they understood about this is the same as what I'm going to teach.
translatedText: 我很好奇那些回答 d 的人，在讲座结束时他们是否会说他们对此的理解与我要教的内容相同。

input: Because for example, I would make the claim that this formula actually has nothing to do with the number e, okay?
translatedText: 因为例如，我会声称这个公式实际上与数字 e 无关，好吗？

input: That the number e doesn't actually play a role in what this formula is computationally saying.
translatedText: 数字 e 实际上在这个公式的计算结果中并不发挥作用。

input: And I'd be curious if those who claim that they understand it well would agree with that statement.
translatedText: 我很好奇那些声称自己很了解这一点的人是否会同意这种说法。

input: After that we have those who've seen it but are confused by it, and at the very end is the actual target demographic of those who've never seen it before.
translatedText: 之后是那些看过但对此感到困惑的人，最后是那些以前从未见过的人的实际目标人群。

input: Oh, I don't know if it's fair to call that the target demographic because I think sometimes you see it in an odd circumstance here or there, but definitely those who answered a or b, you're my people.
translatedText: 哦，我不知道称其为目标人群是否公平，因为我认为有时你会在一些奇怪的情况下看到它，但绝对是那些回答 a 或 b 的人，你们是我的人。

input: You're the ones that I want to talk to about this, okay?
translatedText: 我想和你们谈谈这件事，好吗？

input: But let's say you see this, okay?
translatedText: 但假设你看到了这个，好吗？

input: You see this weird formula e to the pi i, or the generalization e to the i times some angle.
translatedText: 你会看到这个奇怪的公式 e 到 pi i，或者泛化 e 到 i 乘以某个角度。

input: I think the healthy reaction to have to this, okay, if you're just seeing this for the first time, the healthy question to ask is w t f, okay?
translatedText: 我认为对此的健康反应，好吧，如果你是第一次看到这个，那么要问的健康问题是“wtf”，好吗？

input: What is the function at play, and how is it defined, okay?
translatedText: 它的作用是什么，它是如何定义的，好吗？

input: What's the function?
translatedText: 有什么作用呢？

input: Because in this case the function is e to the x, and we're plugging in certain imaginary inputs.
translatedText: 因为在这种情况下，函数是 e 到 x，并且我们插入某些虚数输入。

input: And I think a lot of people think that that refers to taking a number e and multiplying by itself some number of times, and that x describes how often you're multiplying by itself.
translatedText: 我认为很多人认为这指的是取一个数字 e 并与其自身相乘一定次数，而 x 描述了与自身相乘的频率。

input: And that yeah, there's some notion of extending that to things like one half or negative one, or any kind of real number, but that it's based in this idea of repeated multiplication.
translatedText: 是的，有一些概念可以将其扩展到二分之一或负数或任何类型的实数，但它是基于重复乘法的想法。

input: Now the thing that makes this equation misleading is that that's not the function.
translatedText: 现在让这个方程产生误导的是它不是函数。

input: That is not what e to the x is referring to.
translatedText: 这不是 e 到 x 所指的。

input: Let's emphasize that very heavily.
translatedText: 让我们非常强调这一点。

input: This is not what e to the x means.
translatedText: 这不是 e 到 x 的意思。

input: This is not its convention.
translatedText: 这不是它的惯例。

input: Instead, what has emerged in math is that we use e to the x to be a shorthand for another function.
translatedText: 相反，数学中出现的是我们使用 e 代替 x 作为另一个函数的简写。

input: A function which I'm going to give the name exp.
translatedText: 我将把这个函数命名为 exp。

input: This is how you often see it in literature.
translatedText: 这就是你在文学中经常看到的。

input: And it's defined to be a certain polynomial.
translatedText: 它被定义为某个多项式。

input: It's one plus x plus x squared divided by two plus x cubed divided by six plus x to the power four divided by twenty four.
translatedText: 它是一加x 加x 平方除以二加x 立方除以六加x 的四次方除以二十四。

input: And in fact it's not a polynomial, it's an infinite polynomial.
translatedText: 事实上它不是一个多项式，而是一个无限多项式。

input: We add infinitely many terms, each of which look like x to the n divided by n factorial.
translatedText: 我们添加无限多个项，每一项看起来都像 x 除以 n 的阶乘。

input: The proper term for this is a series.
translatedText: 正确的术语是系列。

input: In practice, if you're actually computing this, because that denominator grows so quickly, you can chop off the series pretty early to get an approximate value for what this actually is.
translatedText: 在实践中，如果您实际上正在计算这个值，因为分母增长得如此之快，您可以很早就截断该级数以获得实际值的近似值。

input: Now right away we can see that this is going to work for lots of kinds of x that we could plug in.
translatedText: 现在我们马上就可以看到这对于我们可以插入的许多类型的 x 都适用。

input: Anything where we know how to raise x to a power, just a whole number power, multiply it by itself, and where we know how to divide by a factorial and add those together, we can come up with a nice meaning for what this exp function means.
translatedText: 任何我们知道如何求 x 的幂的地方，只是一个整数的幂，将它乘以它自己，以及我们知道如何除以阶乘并将它们加在一起，我们可以为这个 exp 得出一个很好的含义函数的意思。

input: But before we jump into things like complex numbers and throwing that in, I think it would be very unsatisfying to do that if we didn't first draw the connection to the number e and the idea of repeated multiplication.
translatedText: 但在我们开始讨论复数并把它放进去之前，我认为如果我们不首先把它与数字 e 和重复乘法的想法联系起来，那么这样做会非常令人不满意。

input: Because on the surface, this infinite polynomial seems very different from the idea of some special constant of nature e and raising it to a power.
translatedText: 因为从表面上看，这个无限多项式似乎与某些特殊的自然常数 e 并将其求幂的想法非常不同。

input: So let's build up a little familiarity.
translatedText: 所以让我们建立一点熟悉感。

input: We're going to take a couple minutes to do this.
translatedText: 我们将花费几分钟来完成此操作。

input: And it's a very healthy exercise, I think, to become friends with this function by starting to plug in a couple different values.
translatedText: 我认为，通过开始插入几个不同的值来成为这个函数的朋友是一个非常健康的练习。

input: One of the first you might plug in is the number 1.
translatedText: 您可能首先插入的数字之一是数字 1。

input: So that way we get 1 and then x is 1, so that's 1.
translatedText: 这样我们就得到 1，然后 x 就是 1，所以就是 1。

input: x squared is still 1, so that's 1 half.
translatedText: x 的平方仍然是 1，所以是 1 的一半。

input: And then 1 sixth.
translatedText: 然后是六分之一。

input: And then 1 twenty fourth.
translatedText: 然后是 1 二十四。

input: And in general we're adding 1 divided by n factorial.
translatedText: 一般来说，我们将 1 除以 n 阶乘相加。

input: In math we say that this is a series that converges in the sense that as we add more and more terms, it approaches a certain value and it gets closer and closer to some specific value.
translatedText: 在数学中，我们说这是一个收敛级数，因为随着我们添加越来越多的项，它会接近某个值，并且越来越接近某个特定值。

input: And that value ends up being around 2.
translatedText: 该值最终约为 2。

input: 71828, the Andrew Jackson number.
translatedText: 71828，安德鲁·杰克逊号码。

input: But at this point, just think of it as it was going to be something.
translatedText: 但在这一点上，只要想想它将会成为什么。

input: x of 1 was going to be something.
translatedText: x of 1 将会是某种东西。

input: This is what x of 1 happens to be.
translatedText: 这就是 x of 1 的情况。

input: At the moment there isn't necessarily anything special about that.
translatedText: 目前这不一定有什么特别的。

input: But let's say you wanted to plug in other values.
translatedText: 但假设您想插入其他值。

input: Just to get a little practice with what that would look like, if I wanted x of 2, it would look like 1 plus 2 plus 2 squared over 2 plus 2 cubed over 6.
translatedText: 只是为了稍微练习一下它的样子，如果我想要 x of 2，它看起来就像 1 加 2 加 2 的平方除以 2 加 2 的立方除以 6。

input: And in principle if you were on a desert island and you just needed to compute x of 2, you could work this all out by hand if you were comfortable with long division.
translatedText: 原则上，如果你在一个荒岛上，你只需要计算 2 的 x，如果你熟悉长除法，你可以手动计算出这一切。

input: But of course we live in the modern world, we have computers, we have programming.
translatedText: 但当然，我们生活在现代世界，我们有计算机，我们有编程。

input: So I think to make this especially concrete, let's go ahead and actually implement this function so that we can calculate a couple values.
translatedText: 因此，我认为为了使这一点特别具体，让我们继续实际实现这个函数，以便我们可以计算几个值。

input: And so that it's not a black box, it's not just a calculator that's been handed to us, we implement it so we know exactly what it's doing.
translatedText: 所以它不是一个黑匣子，它不仅仅是一个交给我们的计算器，我们实现它，所以我们确切地知道它在做什么。

input: So for that, let's go ahead and pull up a little Python.
translatedText: 为此，让我们继续学习一点 Python。

input: This is Desmos, we might look at that a little bit later.
translatedText: 这是 Desmos，我们稍后会看到。

input: Right now let's be a little bit more programmatic.
translatedText: 现在让我们更加程序化一点。

input: Let's pull up some Python, let's import some math, because that's a sign you're always going to have some fun.
translatedText: 让我们学习一些 Python，导入一些数学知识，因为这表明您总是会从中获得乐趣。

input: Then I'm going to define the exp function that's going to take in some number x.
translatedText: 然后我将定义 exp 函数，它将接受一些数字 x。

input: And what I want is to return something that looks like 1 plus x plus x squared over 2, where in Python this double, what do you call it, an asterisk, this double asterisk sign is how we do exponentiation.
translatedText: 我想要的是返回看起来像 1 加 x 加 x 的平方除以 2 的值，在 Python 中，这个双精度数，你怎么称呼它，星号，这个双星号符号就是我们求幂的方式。

input: And then x cubed over 6, and we kind of want to add that up a whole bunch.
translatedText: 然后 x 的立方除以 6，我们想把它加起来一大堆。

input: Of course instead of typing all that out, we can use a little special syntax where I'm going to say, I want you to return a sum of a bunch of terms.
translatedText: 当然，我们可以使用一些特殊的语法，而不是全部输入，我要说的是，我希望您返回一堆术语的总和。

input: Each term is going to look like raising x to some power, and it knows what x is because that's what was handed to it.
translatedText: 每一项看起来都像是 x 的某个幂，并且它知道 x 是什么，因为这就是传递给它的东西。

input: x to some power divided by the factorial.
translatedText: x 除以阶乘的某个幂。

input: Factorial of n.
translatedText: n 的阶乘。

input: And that's built into this math package that we imported.
translatedText: 这内置于我们导入的数学包中。

input: And I'm just going to do this for values of n that start at 0.
translatedText: 我将针对从 0 开始的 n 值执行此操作。

input: 0 factorial is defined to be 1 if you're curious.
translatedText: 如果您好奇的话，0 阶乘被定义为 1。

input: We could talk all about factorials of weird values at a later date, but that's all you need to know here.
translatedText: 我们可以稍后讨论奇怪值的阶乘，但这就是您在这里需要知道的全部内容。

input: And I'm just going to have it range up to 100 because 100 factorial is going to be huge.
translatedText: 我将其范围设置为 100，因为 100 的阶乘会很大。

input: So that's going to be plenty big enough for a denominator to be small enough that those later terms don't contribute a lot.
translatedText: 因此，这将足够大，使得分母足够小，以至于后面的项不会产生太大影响。

input: So even if you don't know Python, I hope that this is a reasonably clear way to turn the math into something that our computer can chew on, and crunch through the numbers so that we don't have to.
translatedText: 因此，即使您不懂 Python，我也希望这是一种相当清晰的方法，可以将数学 转化为我们的计算机可以咀嚼的东西，并处理这些数字，这样我们就不必这样做了。

input: So for example, if we type x of 1, we get the Andrew Jackson number.
translatedText: 例如，如果我们输入 x of 1，我们就会得到 Andrew Jackson 数。

input: 71828, on and on.
And I could type in x of 2, and it looks like that's around 7.
translatedText: 我可以输入 x of 2，看起来大约是 7。 389.

input: So maybe we even write that in our notes.
translatedText: 所以也许我们甚至会在笔记中写下这一点。

input: We go over here and say, interesting, x of 2 was about 7.
translatedText: 我们走到这里说，有趣的是，2 的 x 大约是 7。 389.

input: Okay.
translatedText: 好的。

input: And if you spend a long time just kind of playing around with this, okay, I think it's not obvious that you might find this, but if you were just plugging in a couple values, x of 3, x of 4, one important fact you might stumble across is that if I add two numbers in the input, okay, so in this case I get 1096 when I plug in 7, which is 3 plus 4, that actually ends up being the same as if I plug in x of 3 times x of 4.
translatedText: 如果你花了很长时间只是玩这个，好吧，我认为你可能会发现这个并不 明显，但如果你只是插入几个值，x of 3，x of 4，一个 重要的事实你可能会偶然发现，如果我在输入中添加两个数字，好吧， 所以在这种情况下，当我插入 7 时，我得到 1096，即 3 加 4，实际上最终结果与我插入 x 的结果相同4 的 3 倍。

input: Okay.
translatedText: 好的。

input: So adding the input corresponds to multiplying in the output.
translatedText: 因此，输入的加法相当于输出的乘法。

input: And 3 and 4 weren't special here, I could have done, you know, 5.
translatedText: 3 和 4 在这里并不特别，我本来可以做 5。

input: 5 and 3.
2, and that would have gotten me some value.
translatedText: 5和3。 2，这会给我带来一些价值。

input: And if instead I had added those together, okay, it gets the same value.
translatedText: 如果我把它们加在一起，好吧，它会得到相同的值。

input: That is not at all obvious, okay?
translatedText: 这一点也不明显，好吗？

input: So I think that would be a genuine discovery to have with respect to this function, with this polynomial, if that was something that you found.
translatedText: 所以我认为，如果你发现了这个函 数和这个多项式，那将是一个真正的发现。

input: And it's important enough that I want to write it down.
translatedText: 这件事非常重要，我想把它写下来。

input: exp of a plus b is actually the same thing as exp of a times exp of b.
translatedText: a 加 b 的 exp 实际上与 a 乘以 b 的 exp 是一样的。

input: Now if you just look at the polynomial, this is not clear.
translatedText: 现在如果你只看多项式，这是不清楚的。

input: Okay, this is not something that, like, you look at it and say, oh yes, of course, it couldn't have been any other way.
translatedText: 好吧，这不是那种你看着它然后说，哦，是的，当然，不可能有其他方式的东西。

input: At the end of today's lesson, though, I'm going to give you guys some homework, and yes, homework will make you learn better.
translatedText: 不过，在今天的课程结束时，我会给你们布置一些作业，是的，作业会让你们学得更好。

input: And what we're going to do is go through a couple problems that are going to have you show that this fact is true.
translatedText: 我们要做的是解决几个问题，让你证明这个事实是正确的。

input: That simply from the polynomial, and the fact that it includes these factorial terms, excuse me, that's going to be enough to show this very special property.
translatedText: 对不起，这只是多项式的事实，而且它包含这 些阶乘项，这足以证明这个非常特殊的性质。

input: Now why am I calling it a very special property?
translatedText: 为什么我称它为非常特殊的财产？

input: Well, I want to ask you a certain question that will hopefully make this clear.
translatedText: 好吧，我想问你一个问题，希望能澄清这一点。

input: And it really is important that you think this through yourself, because I think if we, uh, if I just kind of tell you the implications here, it's not going to sink in to the same extent as if you really noodle with it yourself.
translatedText: 你自己思考这一点确实很重要，因为我认为如果我们，呃，如果我只 是告诉你这里的含义，它就不会像你自己真的在思考它一样程度。

input: So I'm going to pull up another question, and I'm going to give you some time to think on this one.
translatedText: 所以我要提出另一个问题，我会给你一些时间来思考这个问题。

input: What the question asks us is to suppose that we have some function f of x that has this special property, where adding two numbers in the input, f of a plus b, gives the same result as multiplying in the output, f of a times f of b, and that this is true for any real number, a and b.
translatedText: 问题要求我们假设我们有一些具有这种特殊性质的 x 函数 f，其中将输入中 的两个数字（a 的 f 加 b）相加，得到的结果与输出中的 f 乘以 a 的结果相同f 等于 b，并且这对于任何实数 a 和 b 都是成立的。

input: Okay?
translatedText: 好的？

input: Suppose you have some function that satisfies this property, who cares how it's defined?
translatedText: 假设你有一些满足这个属性的函数，谁关心它是如何定义的呢？

input: Whether it's through this polynomial, through other means.
translatedText: 无论是通过这个多项式，还是通过其他方式。

input: Which of the following is true?
translatedText: 以下内容哪些是对的？

input: One of the options is that f of 5 is equal to f of 1 raised to the power 5.
translatedText: 其中一个选项是 f of 5 等于 f of 1 的 5 次方。

input: Another is that f of 1 half is equal to the square root of f of 1.
translatedText: 另一个是f的1一半等于f的平方根1。

input: And the other is f of negative 1 equals 1 divided by f of 1.
translatedText: 另一个是负1的f等于1除以1的f。

input: Now very important, I'm not asking does there exist some function f where these three things will be true.
translatedText: 现在非常重要的是，我不是问是否存在某个函数 f 满足这三件事。

input: I'm asking which of these necessarily has to be true only from that property.
translatedText: 我问的是，其中哪一个必须仅从该属性来看才是正确的。

input: So you shouldn't be able to contrive some sort of adversarial function that doesn't satisfy it, okay?
translatedText: 所以你不应该设计出某种不能满足它的对抗函数，好吗？

input: And then you have various options for which collection of these three things is true.
translatedText: 然后你有多种选择来判断这三件事的集合是否正确。

input: I'm going to give you some time to think about this because I really do think it's important.
translatedText: 我会给你一些时间考虑这个问题，因为我确实认为这很重要。

input: So I'm going to turn up our pause and ponder music to get us in the mood.
translatedText: 所以我要打开暂停并思考音乐来让我们进入心情。

input: And take a desperately needed drink of water.
translatedText: 并喝一杯急需的水。

input: While you're noodling on that, I'm going to go ahead and take a question from the audience.
translatedText: 当你还在思考这个问题时，我将继续回答观众的问题。

input: Where it looks like Serft asks, what do you think is more interesting to someone who is a newcomer to higher level math?
translatedText: 看起来 Serft 会问，对于高等数学的新手来说，你认为什么更有趣？

input: Special case theorems like e to the i pi, or more general cases like e to the i x.
translatedText: 特殊情况定理，例如 e 到 i pi，或更一般的情况，例如 e 到 i x。

input: Oh that is such a great question.
translatedText: 哦，这是一个很好的问题。

input: By the way, anyone who wants to ask questions, go to Twitter and just use the hashtag lockdown math.
translatedText: 顺便说一句，任何想提问的人都可以访问 Twitter，然后使用主题标签锁定数学。

input: Those will be forwarded to me.
translatedText: 这些将转发给我。

input: I think the best way to learn is to have specific examples and really let yourself understand the patterns represented by those specific examples and then generalize them.
translatedText: 我认为最好的学习方法是有具体的例子，真正让自己理解这些具体例子所代表的模式，然后概括它们。

input: For the specific one that you have here, I think if you just see e to the i pi, that doesn't really count as a good specific example that explains the generality.
translatedText: 对于您这里的具体示例，我认为如果您只看到 e 到 i pi，那么这并不能真正算作一个很好的具体示例来解释一般性。

input: It's more that you're plugging in one particular number into a formula.
translatedText: 更重要的是，您将一个特定的数字代入公式中。

input: So in this case e to the i x, as you'll see, it has everything to do with circular motion and between this lecture and the next one, we're going to talk about why that relation might be there.
translatedText: 因此，在本例中，如您所见，它与圆周运动密切相关，在本次讲座和下一次讲座之间，我们将讨论为什么存在这种关系。

input: So the form of having specific examples that aids your understanding wouldn't be a number like e to the i pi.
translatedText: 因此，帮助您理解的具体示例的形式不会是像 e 到 i pi 这样的数字。

input: It would be building a relationship with circular motions in other circumstances, like studying physics where you have a tetherball with some kind of centripetal force and it's orbiting.
translatedText: 在其他情况下，它会与圆周运动建立关系，比如在研究物理学时，你有一个带有某种向心力的绳球，并且它正在绕轨道运行。

input: Or like orbital mechanics.
translatedText: 或者像轨道力学。

input: Anything where you're really understanding the nature of circular motion.
translatedText: 任何能让你真正理解圆周运动本质的东西。

input: That actually prepares you for understanding e to the i x as a generality a little bit better.
translatedText: 这实际上让你更好地理解 e 到 ix 的一般性。

input: So with all of that, answers are still rolling in and I don't want you to feel rushed.
translatedText: 因此，尽管如此，答案仍在不断涌现，我不希望您感到仓促。

input: So I'm going to give a little bit more time here, actually.
translatedText: 所以实际上我会在这里多花一点时间。

input: Because remember, you need to really be sure that if you're saying that something like 2 or 3 or 1 is included in your answer, that any function with this special property necessarily follows that.
translatedText: 因为请记住，您需要真正确定，如果您说答案中包含诸如 2 或 3 或 1 之类的内容，则任何具有此特殊属性的函数都必须遵循这一点。

input: Okay?
translatedText: 好的？

input: Oh, let's see if we can grade it when the top answer is the year.
translatedText: 哦，让我们看看当最高答案是年份时我们是否可以对它进行评分。

input: So 2017, that's a little bit in the past.
translatedText: 2017年，已经过去了一些了。

input: 2013, we're losing the top answer.
translatedText: 2013 年，我们正在失去最重要的答案。

input: Interesting, people are changing their mind.
translatedText: 有趣的是，人们正在改变想法。

input: It's like we're going back in time.
translatedText: 就好像我们回到了过去。

input: So it looks like a couple people are, oh now we're in the future, 2023.
translatedText: 所以看起来有几个人在说，哦，现在我们正处于未来，2023 年。

input: Yeah, so we're actually seeing people think about it and thinking, hang on, is it the case that option 3 here is necessarily true?
translatedText: 是的，所以我们实际上看到人们在思考这个问题，并思考，等等，这里的选项 3 一定是正确的吗？

input: And they're really being critical about that.
translatedText: 他们对此确实持批评态度。

input: So that's a good sign.
translatedText: 所以这是一个好兆头。

input: If you want to keep thinking about it, please do.
translatedText: 如果你想继续思考，请继续思考。

input: But for the sake of continuing with the lesson, I'm going to go ahead and lock things in here and see how people ended up answering.
translatedText: 但为了继续本课，我将继续将内容锁定在这里，看看人们最终如何回答。

input: So it looks like 2030 of you, the decade in the future, believe that all three of these are necessarily true.
translatedText: 所以看起来 2030 年的你们，也就是未来的十年，相信这三个都一定是真的。

input: Second most common answer was B, they only believe that the first one is true.
translatedText: 第二个最常见的答案是 B，他们只相信第一个是正确的。

input: And then after that, people who either included number 2 or number 3.
translatedText: 在那之后，人们要么包括第二名，要么包括第三名。

input: And the correct answer is that all of them are.
translatedText: 正确答案是全部都是。

input: And it's very interesting to walk through why.
translatedText: 详细解释原因非常有趣。

input: I do think it's very elucidating.
translatedText: 我确实认为这非常清楚。

input: So let's go ahead and do this.
translatedText: 那么让我们继续这样做吧。

input: The first one, which it seems like a majority of you believe, is that if we plug in something like 5 to a function with this special property, that it'll be the same as taking f of 1 raised to the fifth.
translatedText: 第一个，似乎你们大多数人都相信，如果我们将像 5 这样的东西插入到具有这种特殊属性的函数中，那么它将与将 1 的 f 提高到第五位相同。

input: Now the reason is that we could also write 5 as 1 plus 1 plus 1 plus 1 plus 1.
translatedText: 原因是我们也可以将 5 写成 1 加 1 加 1 加 1 加 1。

input: And this property of addition in the input becoming multiplication in the output means that's the same thing as writing x of 1 multiplied by itself 5 times.
translatedText: 输入中的加法在输出中变成乘法的这一特性意味着这与将 1 的 x 乘以自身 5 次是一样的。

input: It lets you rewrite the whole thing in terms of x of 1, which I'm going to say 5 times.
translatedText: 它可以让你用 1 的 x 来重写整个事情，我要说 5 次。

input: This is the same as taking x of 1 raised to the power 5.
translatedText: 这与 1 的 x 的 5 次方相同。

input: And here when I'm writing exponentials, anytime you see a natural number or a whole number, it can literally mean multiplying by itself that number of times.
translatedText: 在这里，当我写指数时，任何时候你看到一个自然数或一个整数，它的字面意思可能是与自己相乘那个次数。

input: That's not the same as the fact that e to the x is a shorthand for this crazy polynomial.
translatedText: 这与 e 到 x 是这个疯狂多项式的简写这一事实不同。

input: So that can sometimes get a little confusing, the exponent is playing two different roles.
translatedText: 因此，有时会有点令人困惑，指数扮演着两个不同的角色。

input: And we might give x of 1 a special name, a shorthand.
translatedText: 我们可以给 x of 1 一个特殊的名称，即简写。

input: Let's just call it e for short.
translatedText: 我们简称为e。

input: That's not why we call this number e, by the way.
translatedText: 顺便说一下，这不是我们称这个数字为 e 的原因。

input: It's also not because this is what Euler's name starts with.
translatedText: 这也不是因为这就是欧拉名字的开头。

input: It's just because whenever Euler was using this, the first time in a particular book, he was partial to vowels and the vowel a had already been used.
translatedText: 只是因为每当欧拉在某本书中第一次使用这个时，他就偏爱元音，而元音a已经被使用了。

input: So e was just his arbitrary letter.
translatedText: 所以e只是他任意的字母。

input: Okay, so simply by virtue of this property, we can see that exp of 5 has to be written in terms of x of 1.
translatedText: 好的，简单地根据这个性质，我们可以看到 5 的 exp 必须写成 1 的 x 的形式。

input: Now a little bit trickier was the question about plugging in one half.
translatedText: 现在有点棘手的是关于插入一半的问题。

input: Okay?
translatedText: 好的？

input: And the key to solving this, it's a little bit tricky, is to think about what happens when we multiply that by itself.
translatedText: 解决这个问题的关键（有点棘手）是考虑当我们将其乘以它本身时会发生什么。

input: Exp of one half times exp of one half, because of this property, has to satisfy, or I should say has to equal exp of one half plus exp of one half.
translatedText: 二分之一的exp乘以二分之一的exp，由于这个性质，必须满足，或者我应该说必须等于二分之一的exp加上二分之一的exp。

input: Which is of course exp of 1, which let's say we're using the shorthand and we call it e.
translatedText: 这当然是 1 的 exp，假设我们使用简写，我们称之为 e。

input: So what does that mean?
translatedText: 那么这是什么意思呢？

input: Exp of one half has to be a number such that multiplying it by itself equals e.
translatedText: 二分之一的 Exp 必须是一个数字，其乘以自身等于 e。

input: Well that's what we mean when we write square roots.
translatedText: 这就是我们写平方根时的意思。

input: And the last one was talking about negative inputs.
translatedText: 最后一个谈论的是负面投入。

input: So just as an example, if we inputted something like negative 1.
translatedText: 举个例子，如果我们输入负数 1 之类的东西。

input: So the key here is to ask about multiplying it by the value when you plug in 1.
translatedText: 所以这里的关键是询问如何将其乘以插入 1 时的值。

input: By this rule, that addition in the input turns into multiplication in the output, that has to be the same as exp of 0.
translatedText: 根据这条规则，输入中的加法会变成输出中的乘法，它必须与 0 的 exp 相同。

input: Now what is exp of 0?
translatedText: 现在 0 的 exp 是多少？

input: Ooh, you know what I'm realizing?
translatedText: 哦，你知道我在意识到什么吗？

input: Hmm.
translatedText: 唔。

input: I think I might have actually made the, entered a wrong answer there.
translatedText: 我想我可能实际上已经做出了，在那里输入了错误的答案。

input: Because in our case, in our case exp of 0 actually does come out to be the number 1.
translatedText: 因为在我们的例子中，exp 0 实际上确实是数字 1。

input: Okay, so if we plug in 0 for x, then all of these, you add them together, the only term that matters is 1.
translatedText: 好吧，如果我们为 x 代入 0，那么所有这些，你把它们加在一起，唯一重要的是 1。

input: So exp of negative 1 times exp of 1 is equal to exp of 0, which is 1.
translatedText: 因此负 1 的 exp 乘以 1 的 exp 等于 0 的 exp，即 1。

input: So this is true in the case of exp.
translatedText: 所以对于 exp 来说也是如此。

input: I, I can't actually think to myself right now if that's necessarily true.
translatedText: 我，我现在无法思考这是否一定是真的。

input: You know, if we look at our question, where it's saying all we know about f is that f of a plus b is f of a times f of b.
translatedText: 你知道，如果我们看一下我们的问题，它说明我们对 f 的了解就是 a 加 b 的 f 等于 a 的 f 乘以 b 的 f。

input: If that necessarily implies that f of 0 is going to be 1.
translatedText: 如果这必然意味着 0 的 f 将是 1。

input: And I don't think it does, I think we could construct a function.
translatedText: 我认为不会，我认为我们可以构造一个函数。

input: Yeah, because we could just scale e to the x by some other amount.
translatedText: 是的，因为我们可以将 e 按其他量缩放到 x。

input: Okay, yeah, so actually what's graded here is not entirely correct.
translatedText: 好吧，是的，所以实际上这里的评分并不完全正确。

input: The correct answer would be only 1 and 2.
translatedText: 正确答案只有1和2。

input: I think.
translatedText: 我认为。

input: Someone correct me on Twitter if I'm wrong about that.
translatedText: 如果我的说法有误，有人会在 Twitter 上纠正我。

input: But, very interesting.
translatedText: 但是，非常有趣。

input: So if we go back to our paper, let's see.
translatedText: 所以，如果我们回到我们的论文，让我们看看。

input: In the case of exp, this value at 0 would be 1.
translatedText: 对于 exp，该值为 0 时为 1。

input: What does that imply?
translatedText: 这意味着什么？

input: Well, if we call exp of 1 e, that means we're asking what is the number which when you multiply by e equals 1.
translatedText: 好吧，如果我们称 1 e 为 exp，这意味着我们要问乘以 e 等于 1 的数字是多少。

input: And it would be 1 divided by e.
translatedText: 它将是 1 除以 e。

input: But yeah, for the general case, we need the added condition that when you plug in 0 you do get 1.
translatedText: 但是，是的，对于一般情况，我们需要附加条件，即当您插入 0 时，您确实会得到 1。

input: Now the point of all of this, the reason that I'm saying this, is to emphasize why it's reasonable that we use the shorthand.
translatedText: 现在所有这一切的重点，我这么说的原因，是为了强调为什么我们使用简写是合理的。

input: That when we say exp of x, for real numbers x, why it would be very reasonable to write this as e to the power x.
translatedText: 当我们说 x 的 exp 时，对于实数 x，为什么将其写为 e 的 x 次方是非常合理的。

input: Because basically this special property means that because you can use the number 1 to access pretty much all the real numbers by adding it to itself or dividing as needed or negating.
translatedText: 因为基本上这个特殊属性意味着，因为您可以使用数字 1 通过将其与自身相加或根据需要除以或取负来访问几乎所有实数。

input: And then if you have certain continuity restrictions that will let you extend from rational numbers to all the reals.
translatedText: 然后，如果您有某些连续性限制，则可以让您从有理数扩展到所有实数。

input: But that's a technical point, you don't need to fuss over for what we're doing right now.
translatedText: 但这是一个技术点，你不需要为我们现在正在做的事情大惊小怪。

input: It lets you basically express everything that this polynomial can output in terms of what it outputs at the number 1.
translatedText: 它基本上可以让您用数字 1 的输出来表达该多项式可以输出的所有内容。

input: So you might read e to the x as just, whatever this polynomial is at the input 1, we can start exponentiating in terms of that.
translatedText: 因此，您可以将 e 读为 x，无论输入 1 处的多项式是什么，我们都可以开始据此求幂。

input: So that's the connection, right?
translatedText: 这就是联系，对吗？

input: We could, if we wanted, define the number e to simply be, where is this polynomial at the number 1?
translatedText: 如果我们愿意，我们可以将数字 e 简单地定义为：这个多项式在数字 1 处的位置？

input: And then all of this would follow.
translatedText: 然后这一切都会随之而来。

input: But I really want to emphasize that only makes sense for real numbers.
translatedText: 但我真的想强调这仅对实数有意义。

input: Because as soon as we start introducing things like complex numbers, you can't just add 1 to itself or subtract and divide and get the number i.
translatedText: 因为一旦我们开始引入复数之类的东西，你就不能只加 1 或减去并除以得到数字 i。

input: And in math you often do even crazier things, where you plug in things like matrices into this polynomial, which seems weird, but you know, you can take a matrix and square it, you can divide it by 2, you can add all of those together.
translatedText: 在数学中你经常做更疯狂的事情，你把矩阵之类的东西代入这个多项式，这看起来很奇怪，但你知道，你可以取一个矩阵并对其求平方，你可以将它除以2，你可以将所有那些在一起。

input: And that's actually a very useful thing.
translatedText: 这实际上是一件非常有用的事情。

input: It's very useful for a field called differential equations, which in turn is useful for physics.
translatedText: 它对于微分方程领域非常有用，而微分方程又对物理学很有用。

input: In quantum mechanics you often plug in these things called operators, which are kind of like the mature older brother of matrices.
translatedText: 在量子力学中，你经常插入称为运算符的东西，它们有点像矩阵的成熟哥哥。

input: And all of that looks totally nonsensical if we're talking about a constant raised to some kind of power.
translatedText: 如果我们谈论的是常数的某种幂，那么所有这些看起来都是完全荒谬的。

input: But what you have to understand is that it's being plugged into this polynomial.
translatedText: 但你必须明白的是，它被插入到这个多项式中。

input: So I understand why we have the convention of writing this as e to the x.
translatedText: 所以我明白为什么我们习惯将其写为 x 的 e。

input: It makes sense for real numbers.
translatedText: 这对于实数来说是有意义的。

input: But I think that's actually a bad convention as soon as we start extending it, and I think that causes a lot of undue confusion.
translatedText: 但我认为，一旦我们开始扩展它，这实际上是一个糟糕的约定，并且我认为这会导致很多不必要的混乱。

input: So with all of that said, let's finally have some fun and plug in some complex values.
translatedText: 说了这么多，我们终于可以享受一些乐趣并插入一些复杂的值了。

input: And before we do that, just as kind of a warm up, I want to make sure that we're comfortable with powers of i, because that's what's going to be important here.
translatedText: 在我们这样做之前，就像热身一样，我想确保我们对 i 的力量感到满意，因为这才是这里最重要的。

input: So let's pull up our quiz, and let's go ahead and ask one more question, and then I'll take a question from the audience too while you guys think about this.
translatedText: 那么，让我们进行测验，然后再问一个问题，然后当你们思考这个问题时，我也会回答观众的问题。

input: Remember that i is defined to be a value that satisfies i squared equals negative 1.
translatedText: 请记住，i 被定义为满足 i 平方等于负 1 的值。

input: So that's defined.
translatedText: 这样就定义好了。

input: For which values of n does i to the power n equal negative i?
translatedText: 对于哪些 n 值，i 的 n 次方等于负 i？

input: So the spirit of this question is to have people thinking deeply about powers of i.
translatedText: 所以这个问题的精神就是让人们深入思考i的幂。

input: And I wanted it to be a question that's not totally obvious, so one that you do have to put a little mental energy into.
translatedText: 我希望这是一个并不完全显而易见的问题，因此你必须投入一点精力。

input: So let's go ahead and take a question from the audience while I take a drink of water.
translatedText: 那么，让我们在我喝水的时候回答观众的问题。

input: f of x equals 0 doesn't work with f of negative 1 equals 1 over f of 1.
translatedText: x 的 f 等于 0 不适用于负 1 的 f 等于 1 大于 1 的 f。

input: Yeah, f of x equals 0.
translatedText: 是的，x 的 f 等于 0。

input: Oh, interesting, yeah, okay.
translatedText: 哦，有趣，是的，好吧。

input: So they're saying that if f of x ever outputs 0, actually I'm not entirely sure what Sam was saying.
translatedText: 所以他们说如果 x 的 f 输出 0，实际上我并不完全确定 Sam 在说什么。

input: f of x equals 0 doesn't work with f of negative 1 equals 1 over f of 1.
translatedText: x 的 f 等于 0 不适用于负 1 的 f 等于 1 大于 1 的 f。

input: So I guess that fact that f of negative 1 is 1 over f of 1 doesn't imply that the output will ever be 0.
translatedText: 所以我猜负 1 的 f 是 1 大于 1 的 f 的事实并不意味着输出将永远是 0。

input: So I could ask for some clarification, but I think that might be getting at the general point of the mistake of the question, which was to assume, to extend the idea of exp a little bit too much, where the fact that exp of 0 equals 1 gives us this other property.
translatedText: 所以我可以要求一些澄清，但我认为这可能是问题的错误的一般要点，即假设将 exp 的想法扩展得有点太多，事实上 exp 为 0等于 1 给了我们另一个属性。

input: And then Crispin Simmons says 3 is included because f of x plus 0- Oh, okay, yeah, okay, great, great.
translatedText: 然后 Crispin Simmons 说 3 被包括在内，因为 x 的 f 加 0 - 哦，好吧，是的，好吧，太棒了，太棒了。

input: Yeah, someone thought this through a little bit more deeply than I can while live and on camera and under some pressure.
translatedText: 是的，有人在现场、在镜头前、在一定压力下对这个问题的思考比我更深入。

input: f of x plus 0 is the same as f of x times f of 0, which implies f of x equals 1.
translatedText: f of x 加 0 与 f of x 乘以 f of 0 相同，这意味着 x 的 f 等于 1。

input: Awesome, Crispin, you saved me.
translatedText: 太棒了，克里斯平，你救了我。

input: You saved me on this one.
translatedText: 你在这件事上救了我。

input: That's a beautiful way of thinking about it.
translatedText: 这是一个很好的思考方式。

input: Yeah, all of these questions where you have like a property of a function and you're supposed to deduce facts, they can be very subtle.
translatedText: 是的，所有这些问题，如果你有一个函数的属性，你应该推断出事实，它们可能非常微妙。

input: And so in this case, okay, the question was graded correctly.
translatedText: 所以在这种情况下，好吧，问题的评分是正确的。

input: The property simply that addition in the input becomes multiplication in the output is enough to imply f of 0 equals 1, which in turn locks in the value for f of negative 1.
translatedText: 输入中的加法变成输出中的乘法这一性质就足以暗示 0 的 f 等于 1，这又锁定了负 1 的 f 值。

input: Oh, it's so pleasing.
translatedText: 噢，真令人高兴。

input: One little property can just lock in basic, not the whole real number line, because it didn't assume continuity, but it locks in pretty much any value you want.
translatedText: 一个小属性只能锁定基本的，而不是整个实数轴，因为它没有假 设连续性，但它几乎锁定了您想要的任何值。

input: Awesome, excellent questions.
translatedText: 太棒了，非常好的问题。

input: I love live stuff.
translatedText: 我喜欢活生生的东西。

input: Even if I make errors, it does feel a little more interactive than the usual videos.
translatedText: 即使我犯了错误，它确实比通常的视频更具互动性。

input: So let's see how we're doing on the quiz.
translatedText: 那么让我们看看我们的测验表现如何。

input: Looks like we've still got some answers rolling in.
translatedText: 看起来我们仍然有一些答案。

input: We're trying to understand which powers of i are equal to negative i.
translatedText: 我们试图了解 i 的哪些幂等于负 i。

input: And the options include multiples of 3 or multiples of 3 as long as they're positive, or integers 1 below a multiple of 4 or those where you're restricted to them just being positive.
translatedText: 这些选项包括 3 的倍数或 3 的倍数，只要它们是正数 ，或者小于 4 的倍数的整数 1 或仅限于正数的整数。

input: And I'm going to go ahead and grade this question.
translatedText: 我将继续对这个问题进行评分。

input: And as always, if you feel like you weren't done by the time I'm locking it in, know that that's just for the sake of letting the lesson progress forward.
translatedText: 和往常一样，如果你觉得在我锁定它时你还没 有完成，请知道这只是为了让课程继续进行。

input: If you wanted to pause and think about it further yourself, especially if you're watching this later, that would be totally in the spirit of these lessons.
translatedText: 如果您想停下来进一步思考，特别是如果您稍后再 观看此内容，那么这完全符合这些课程的精神。

input: Okay, so the majority, or the plurality I guess, of you answered that it's all integers 1 below a multiple of 4, which is correct.
translatedText: 好的，所以大多数人，或者我猜的多数人，回答说都是 1 小于 4 的倍数的整数，这是正确的。

input: And the second most common answer was basically the same but restricted to positives.
translatedText: 第二个最常见的答案基本相同，但仅限于积极的一面。

input: Great, so let's think through what powers of i actually look like, because this is going to be the only thing we really need to plug in complex values into this exp function.
translatedText: 太好了，让我们考虑一下 i 的幂实际上是什么样的，因为这将 是我们真正需要将复数插入到这个 exp 函数中的唯一东西。

input: And the way this can work, if I pull out my infinite supply of unit circles, is to remember that multiplication in the complex plane includes a rotation component.
translatedText: 如果我拿出无限的单位圆，那么它的工作方 式就是记住复平面中的乘法包括旋转分量。

input: And because i has a magnitude of 1, there's only rotation.
translatedText: 因为 i 的大小为 1，所以只有旋转。

input: So multiplying by i has the effect of rotating 90 degrees.
translatedText: 所以乘以i就有旋转90度的效果。

input: If you multiply by i twice, i squared, you end up 180 degrees around.
translatedText: 如果你乘以 i 两次，即 i 的平方，你就会得到 180 度的结果。

input: Reassuring it's supposed to have a square of negative 1, and this geometry lines up with that fact.
translatedText: 令人放心的是，它应该有一个负 1 的平方，并且这个几何形状与这个事实相符。

input: If we multiply by itself three times to get i cubed, it ends up being a vector pointing straight down.
translatedText: 如果我们乘以自身三倍来得到 i 的立方，它最终会成为一个垂直向下的向量。

input: Multiplying by itself a fourth time, 90 degrees, takes us back to 1.
translatedText: 第四次乘以 90 度，我们就回到了 1。

input: So i to the fourth is 1, and then after that they all start repeating.
translatedText: 所以 i 到第四个是 1，然后它们都开始重复。

input: So basically all you need to know is where's that exponent with respect to powers of 4.
translatedText: 所以基本上你需要知道的是 4 的幂的指数在哪里。

input: If it's a power of 4, you're at 1.
translatedText: 如果它是 4 的幂，那么你就是 1。

input: If it's 1 above a power of 4, you're at i.
translatedText: 如果它是 1 的 4 次方以上，则您处于 i 处。

input: Now the trickiness of the question was to also include the nuance of whether this is only for positive powers or negative powers.
translatedText: 现在问题的棘手之处在于还包括这是否仅适用于积极权力或消极权力的细微差别。

input: But what a negative power means, if we write something like i to the negative 1, that's defined to be 1 over i, the number such that when you multiply by it, you get 1.
translatedText: 但是负幂意味着什么，如果我们把像 i 这样的东西写到负 1 上 ，那么它就被定义为 1 除以 i，这个数字乘以它就得到 1。

input: And you can see that that's actually the same as i cubed.
translatedText: 你可以看到这实际上和我的立方一样。

input: This is the same as i cubed because that's a number where when we multiply it by i, we get 1.
translatedText: 这与 i 的立方相同，因为这是一个数字，当我们将它乘以 i 时，我们得到 1。

input: Negative 1, that's also 1 below a multiple of 4.
translatedText: 负 1，也就是 4 的倍数之下的 1。

input: And in general, anything that's 1 below all the negative multiples of 4 will also satisfy this property.
translatedText: 一般来说，任何低于 4 的所有负倍数 1 的值也都满足这个性质。

input: So it's a little tricky question, but it's just because I wanted you to think deeply about this idea, that powers of i, of whole numbers, just have us ticking forward by 90 degrees.
translatedText: 所以这是一个有点棘手的问题，但这只是因为我想让你深入思考这 个想法，整数的 i 的幂，只是让我们向前移动 90 度。

input: And finally, we can have our fun.
translatedText: 最后，我们可以玩得开心了。

input: We can take our crazy exp function, and we could plug it into Python if we wanted to and see how things play there.
translatedText: 我们可以使用我们疯狂的 exp 函数，如果我们愿意的话，我们可以将它插入到 Python 中，看看那里的情况如何。

input: But first, let me go ahead and visualize it for you.
translatedText: 但首先，让我为您想象一下。

input: So I'm going to, uh, let's see, that circle is already suggestively drawn, but I don't want that to be there.
translatedText: 所以我要，呃，让我们看看，那个圆圈已经暗示性地画出来了，但我不希望它在那里。

input: I just want you to think about this polynomial where I'm going to plug in i, scaled by some kind of constant, which very suggestively I'm going to give the name theta, and then what that means is taking 1 plus i times theta plus i theta squared over 2, on and on.
translatedText: 我只是想让你想想这个多项式，我将在其中插入 i，按某种常数 缩放，这非常暗示我将给出名称 theta，然后这意味着取 1 加 i 次θ 加上 i θ 的平方除以 2，等等。

input: And just as an example, let's crank theta on up until it equals 1.
translatedText: 举个例子，让我们将 theta 调高直到等于 1。

input: And let's try to think pretty deeply about what this actually means, computationally.
translatedText: 让我们尝试通过计算来深入思考这实际上意味着什么。

input: The first term is 1, which we might draw with this green vector on the bottom, pointed one unit to the right.
translatedText: 第一项是 1，我们可以用底部的绿色向量来绘制它，向右指向一个单位。

input: The next term is going to be i times 1, so just i.
translatedText: 下一项将是 i 乘以 1，所以只有 i。

input: It's pointed straight up with magnitude 1.
translatedText: 它直接指向上方，震级为 1。

input: Now think about what the next term is.
translatedText: 现在想想下一个术语是什么。

input: It's going to be i squared, or i theta squared, but theta is 1, so it's i squared, which is negative 1 over 2.
translatedText: 它将是 i 的平方，或者 i theta 的平方，但 theta 是 1，所以它是 i 的平方，即 1 除以 2 的负数。

input: So that's why this next vector is pointed to the left, and it has length one half.
translatedText: 这就是为什么下一个向量指向左侧，并且长度为一半。

input: Then after that, i cubed is pointed straight down, and we divide it by 6.
translatedText: 然后，i 的立方直接向下，我们将它除以 6。

input: So now we just have an itty bitty vector that is of magnitude one sixth, and then they just get smaller from there.
translatedText: 所以现在我们只有一个大小为六分之一的微小向量，然后它们就从那里变得更小。

input: The next one is pointed to the right, but it has magnitude 1 over 24, and they just shrink a whole bunch.
translatedText: 下一个指向右边，但它的震级为 1 比 24，而且它们只是缩小了一大堆。

input: And so we get something.
translatedText: 这样我们就得到了一些东西。

input: It's clear that this is a computation that makes sense to do.
translatedText: 很明显，这是一个有意义的计算。

input: It's not clear how we would know where it ends up.
translatedText: 目前尚不清楚我们如何知道它最终会去哪里。

input: That feels like it's going to require real math to have some kind of theory behind it.
translatedText: 这感觉就像需要真正的数学来支持某种理论。

input: We could be computational, and pull up Python, and remember that it actually has built-in support for complex numbers.
translatedText: 我们可以进行计算，并调用 Python，并记住它实际上具有对复数的内置支持。

input: If I write something like complex of 2, 3, it gives me a complex number with real part 2 and imaginary part 3.
translatedText: 如果我写出类似 2, 3 的复数，它会给出一个包含实部 2 和虚部 3 的复数。

input: And what's cool is that it already knows the rules for multiplication.
translatedText: 最酷的是它已经知道乘法规则。

input: So I could multiply this by other things.
translatedText: 所以我可以把它乘以其他东西。

input: It knows how to take their product.
translatedText: 它知道如何获取他们的产品。

input: Very cool.
translatedText: 很酷。

input: Now given that, our definition of this exponential function, if you'll remember, was only ever in terms of raising something to a power and scaling it by a factorial.
translatedText: 现在考虑到这一点，如果您还记得的话，我们对这个指数函数的定义只是将某个值求幂并按阶乘缩放。

input: And then adding all those terms up.
translatedText: 然后将所有这些项相加。

input: Well it should make sense to plug in something like complex 0, 1, which is how we write i in Python, and see what it pops out.
translatedText: 好吧，插入像复数 0, 1 这样的东西应该是有意义的，这就是我们在 Python 中编写 i 的方式，然后看看它会弹出什么。

input: And indeed, it crunches through the numbers, and it gets for us something whose real part is evidently around.
translatedText: 事实上，它对数字进行了处理，并为我们提供了一些其真实部分显然就在附近的东西。 54.

input: Who knew?
translatedText: 谁知道？

input: And whose imaginary part is around.
translatedText: 以及谁的虚部就在周围。 84.

input: And in terms of our visual, you know, that checks out.
translatedText: 就我们的视觉效果而言，你知道，这一点是正确的。

input: It looks like the real part is a little above.
translatedText: 看起来真实的部分在上面一点。 5，所以。

input: 5, so.
54, I believe that.
translatedText: 54、我相信这一点。

input: And the imaginary part is, it claimed, what,.
translatedText: 它声称，虚部是什么。 84？

input: Yeah, that seems about right.
translatedText: 是的，这似乎是正确的。

input: So at this point, we can actually think, what is the claim of Euler's formula?
translatedText: 那么此时，我们其实可以思考，欧拉公式的主张是什么？

input: What is it telling us about the behavior here?
translatedText: 这里的行为告诉我们什么？

input: And my hope is that Euler's formula might have started off mysterious, but mysterious in a bad way.
translatedText: 我希望欧拉公式一开始可能很神秘，但神秘的程度很糟糕。

input: Okay?
translatedText: 好的？

input: Because when you initially see this expression, e to the i theta is equal to cosine theta plus i sine theta, telling you that, oh, I guess imaginary exponents get us on the unit circle.
translatedText: 因为当你最初看到这个表达式时，e 到 i theta 等于 cosine theta 加 i sine theta，告诉你，哦，我猜虚数指数让我们在单位圆上。

input: It doesn't leave you wondering about a real pattern, it leaves you wondering what the convention is, right?
translatedText: 它不会让您想知道真正的模式，而是让您想知道约定是什么，对吧？

input: It leaves you wondering, WTF.
translatedText: 这让你想知道，WTF。

input: However, right now what we can see is what this is saying is if I plug in i times theta, evidently that's the same as walking around a unit circle.
translatedText: 然而，现在我们可以看到，如果我插入 i 乘以 θ，这显然与绕单位圆行走相同。

input: Now that feels very substantive, there's a lot of content to be had in that expression.
translatedText: 现在感觉很充实，这个表达有很多内容。

input: Because if we go to our visual, what it's telling us is that if I crank up this value of theta, the place that the sum of vectors converges always sits on a circle that's one of radius one.
translatedText: 因为如果我们看一下我们的视觉效果，它告诉我们的是，如果我提高 theta 值，向量和收敛的位置总是位于半径为 1 的圆上。

input: That's not obvious.
translatedText: 这并不明显。

input: If you just look at this expression and you think through what it's saying very literally, that is definitely not something that just pops right out of it.
translatedText: 如果你只看这个表达，并从字面上思考它的意思，那绝对不是直接从其中跳出来的东西。

input: But it becomes a lot more beautiful, in my opinion, because you're no longer asking questions of convention, you're asking questions of the universe, of actual patterns.
translatedText: 但在我看来，它变得更加美丽，因为你不再提出惯例问题，而是提出宇宙问题、实际模式问题。

input: So just to take the most famous input that there is, plugging in pi around 3.
translatedText: 因此，只要采用最著名的输入，将 pi 代入 3 左右即可。

input: 14, let's think about what this is actually saying.
translatedText: 14、让我们思考一下这实际上在说什么。

input: It's saying, okay, the first term is one, so we've got our vector pointed one unit to the right.
translatedText: 它的意思是，好吧，第一项是 1，所以我们的向量向右指向一个单位。

input: The next term is i times pi.
translatedText: 下一项是 i 乘以 pi。

input: Okay, so that's going to be a vector that's pointed up because of the i with a length of pi around 3.
translatedText: 好的，这将是一个向上的向量，因为 i 的长度 pi 约为 3。

input: 14, which it looks like it is.
translatedText: 14，看起来确实如此。

input: The next one is going to be i squared times pi squared over two.
translatedText: 下一个将是 i 的平方乘以 pi 的平方二。

input: So that i squared means that it's negative, okay, it's pointing to the left.
translatedText: 所以 i 平方意味着它是负数，好吧，它指向左边。

input: And I guess the magnitude is pi squared over two.
translatedText: 我猜其大小是 pi 的平方二。

input: We could do a quick gut check if we wanted and just ask ourselves, you know, what is pi squared?
translatedText: 如果我们愿意的话，我们可以快速进行一下检查，然后问自己，你知道，圆周率的平方是多少？

input: It's around 9.
translatedText: 9点左右了。

input: 8, same as the gravity on Earth in terms of meters per second squared, which is always fun.
translatedText: 8，与地球上的重力相同，单位为米/秒平方，这总是很有趣。

input: And dividing that by two, it looks like it's 4.
translatedText: 将其除以二，看起来是 4。 93.

input: Okay, does that check out?
translatedText: 好的，检查出来了吗？

input: Yeah, I buy it that the length of this vector is just less than five, so 4.
translatedText: 是的，我相信这个向量的长度小于 5，即 4。 93.

input: And then the next one, because of the i cubed, is pointed down and the magnitude is pi cubed over six.
translatedText: 然后下一个，由于 i 的三次方，指向下方，其大小是 pi 的 6 次方。

input: Evidently that's around the magnitude of pi cubed over six.
translatedText: 显然，这大约是圆周率六的立方的大小。

input: And so far the vectors have been getting bigger, but it's at this point they start turning around.
translatedText: 到目前为止，矢量一直在变大，但正是在这一点上，它们开始转向。

input: Because basically each time on the, for each new term, the numerator gets an extra pi thrown in.
translatedText: 因为基本上每次，对于每个新术语，分子都会得到一个额外的 pi。

input: But the denominator now gets an extra four thrown in.
translatedText: 但分母现在多了四。

input: Like going from six to 24, you're multiplying by a four.
translatedText: 就像从 6 到 24 一样，你要乘以 4。

input: And then it's going to get an extra five and then a six.
translatedText: 然后它会得到额外的五分，然后是六分。

input: So the denominator is going to start growing much more than the numerator, which is why the vectors shrink and shrink and start to converge to a point.
translatedText: 因此，分母将开始比分子增长得更多，这就是向量不断缩小并开始收敛到一点的原因。

input: So the i in there is what's letting these vectors all turn 90 degrees each time and give us this very pretty spiral sum.
translatedText: 因此，其中的 i 使这些向量每次都旋转 90 度，并给我们这个非常漂亮的螺旋和。

input: And the claim of Euler's formula is this very fascinating fact that evidently when the vectors are rotating according to powers of i, and when their lengths are changing according to powers of pi divided by n factorial, they all conspire in just the right way, that they land at the point negative one.
translatedText: 欧拉公式的主张是一个非常有趣的事实，显然，当向量根据 i 的幂旋转，并且当它们的长度根据 pi 除以 n 阶乘的幂变化时，它们都以正确的方式聚合，即他们降落在负点。

input: That's interesting.
translatedText: 那很有意思。

input: Still mysterious, but mysterious in a good way.
translatedText: 仍然很神秘，但神秘的程度很好。

input: And it's making an even stronger claim, which is that any other angle that we might put in, it puts us on a unit circle at that angle.
translatedText: 它提出了一个更强有力的主张，即我们可能放入的任何其他角度，它都会使我们处于该角度的单位圆上。

input: Now this is especially mysterious when we consider the fact that as we let this value just continue increasing, it's not even clear that the function would be periodic.
translatedText: 现在，当我们考虑到当我们让这个值继续增加时，甚至不清楚该函数是否是周期性的，这一点尤其神秘。

input: Right?
translatedText: 正确的？

input: Because as theta increases, more and more of the vectors become relevant, because it takes longer and longer for the denominator of our terms to win out, and yet they stay very nicely constrained onto the unit circle.
translatedText: 因为随着 theta 的增加，越来越多的向量变得相关，因为我们的项的分母需要越来越长的时间才能获胜，但它们仍然很好地约束在单位圆上。

input: I think that's interesting.
translatedText: 我认为这很有趣。

input: So just to do a last little concept check here, I'm going to ask you one final question to basically see if you've been paying attention, see if the claims made stand to reason.
translatedText: 因此，为了在这里做最后一个概念检查，我将问您最后一个问题，主要是看看您是否一直在关注，看看所提出的主张是否合理。

input: So getting rid of our powers of i, the last question is a wind-down question of sorts for the evening.
translatedText: 因此，摆脱 i 的力量，最后一个问题是今晚的一个结束问题。

input: Which of the following values is closest to e to the 3i?
translatedText: 以下哪个值最接近 e 到 3i？

input: Okay, so as usual, this is the link you can go to.
translatedText: 好的，像往常一样，这是您可以访问的链接。

input: Which of the following values is closest to e to the 3i?
translatedText: 以下哪个值最接近 e 到 3i？

input: Now as you're answering, let me just remind you that the main takeaway I want you to have from this lesson is that the way that you read this is not to think about a constant e raised to an imaginary power.
translatedText: 现在，当您回答时，让我提醒您，我希望您从本课中学到的主要内容是，您阅读本文的方式不是考虑常数 e 的虚数幂。

input: Because that doesn't really make sense when we're thinking of powers as repeated multiplication.
translatedText: 因为当我们将幂视为重复乘法时，这实际上没有意义。

input: However, what does.
translatedText: 然而，有什么作用呢。

input: Let's see.
translatedText: 让我们来看看。

input: Seems like we have some controversy over the last question.
translatedText: 看来我们对最后一个问题还有一些争议。

input: We'll address that in a moment.
translatedText: 我们稍后会解决这个问题。

input: But what you should think about here is the fact that e to the x is shorthand for this general polynomial, okay?
translatedText: 但这里你应该考虑的是，e 到 x 是这个一般多项式的简写，好吗？

input: And this general polynomial, it turns out to be very relevant in things like calculus in a future lecture.
translatedText: 事实证明，这个一般多项式与未来讲座中的微积分等内容非常相关。

input: I'd like to start talking about why this idea of x to the n over n factorial and adding them up.
translatedText: 我想开始讨论为什么将 x 乘以 n 的阶乘并将它们相加。

input: Why is that useful?
translatedText: 为什么这有用？

input: Why would anyone care?
translatedText: 为什么有人会关心？

input: Why would it give rotation?
translatedText: 为什么它会旋转？

input: But if you know that that's how to read it, hopefully this isn't a nonsense question, and it's not one that just asks you to blindly believe convention.
translatedText: 但如果你知道这就是如何阅读它，希望这不是一个无意义的问题，也不是一个只是要求你盲目相信惯例的问题。

input: It kind of asks you to blindly believe a claim about the fact that this follows a circle, but we'll address that in the next lecture.
translatedText: 它有点要求你盲目地相信关于它遵循一个圆圈这一事实的说法，但我们将在下一堂课中解决这个问题。

input: And I think that's enough time to go ahead and grade this.
translatedText: 我认为有足够的时间继续进行评分。

input: And the correct answer is b, which around 3800 of you nicely got.
translatedText: 正确答案是 b，大约 3800 人都答对了。

input: Well done, well done indeed.
translatedText: 干得好，确实干得好。

input: And it's around negative 0.
translatedText: 而且大约是负0。 99 加 0。

input: 99 plus 0.
So the expectation isn't that you're a machine who can calculate that in your head.
translatedText: 所以我们的期望并不是你是一台可以在头脑中计算的机器。

input: It's instead the idea that if we go over to our visual, where we're plugging in values of theta, and you ask what happens when you plug in 3.
translatedText: 相反，我们的想法是，如果我们转到视觉效果，我们插入 θ 值，然后您会问插入 3 时会发生什么。

input: That the claim of Euler's formula is that we walk 3 units around a unit circle.
translatedText: 欧拉公式的主张是我们绕一个单位圆走了 3 个单位。

input: Knowing that pi units takes us all the way around, 3 units should take us so that the real part is really quite close to negative 1, and the imaginary part is something positive.
translatedText: 知道 pi 单位可以带我们一路走来，3 个单位应该带我们让实部非常接近负 1，而虚部是正值。

input: And of the options you were given, those were the only ones in there.
translatedText: 在给你的选项中，这些是唯一的选项。

input: Now the very last thing that I would like to emphasize here is that nothing about this actual expression has to do with the number E.
translatedText: 现在我想强调的最后一件事是，这个实际表达式与数字 E 无关。

input: Has to do with the number 2.
translatedText: 与数字2有关。

input: 71828 on and on.
If we were to go to the computation taking place, if I plug in something like exp of a complex number whose real part is 0 and whose imaginary part is pi.
translatedText: 如果我们要进行计算，如果我插入一个复数的 exp 之类的东西，其实部为 0，虚部为 pi。

input: Which, at first it might look like it's outputting something other than negative 1, but it's saying the real part is negative 1 and then some numerical error.
translatedText: 乍一看，它可能看起来输出的是负 1 以外的东西，但它表示实部是负 1，然后是一些数值错误。

input: Partly because of how we defined it, you know, only doing so many terms, and partly because computers can't do infinite precision.
translatedText: 部分原因是我们如何定义它，你知道，只做了这么多术语，部分原因是计算机无法实现无限精度。

input: The imaginary part, it might look like it's saying 3.
translatedText: 虚部，看起来可能是 3。

input: 45, but really it's saying times 10 to the negative 16th.
translatedText: 45，但实际上是 10 的乘以 16 的负数。

input: That's what that means.
translatedText: 这就是这个意思。

input: So it's basically 0.
translatedText: 所以基本都是0。

input: If you wanted to see this we could maybe import numpy and do something like round it.
translatedText: 如果你想看到这个，我们可以导入 numpy 并做一些类似的事情。

input: So I can round this thing to, I don't know, 8 decimal places, and we see that, okay, it's basically negative 1.
translatedText: 所以我可以将这个值四舍五入到小数点后 8 位，我们可以看到，好吧，它基本上是负 1。

input: So this is the function that we wrote showing us that e to the pi i is negative 1.
translatedText: 这就是我们编写的函数，向我们展示 e 与 pi i 的乘积是负 1。

input: But what I'd like to emphasize is that nowhere in that function did we include the value 2.
translatedText: 但我想强调的是，在该函数中我们没有包含值 2。 718.

input: In fact, nowhere in the computer's memory during the execution of this computation would it encounter the value 2.
translatedText: 事实上，在执行此计算期间，计算机内存中不会遇到值 2。 718.

input: I would submit to you that that value is not relevant to the equation e to the pi i equals negative 1.
translatedText: 我向您提出，该值与 pi i 等于负 1 的方程 e 无关。

input: Which is kind of funny, right?
translatedText: 这有点有趣，对吧？

input: Let's at least write out what the relationship is, because, you know, I'm not going to say there's no connection between e and pi, there is one.
translatedText: 让我们至少写出这种关系是什么，因为，你知道，我不会说 e 和 pi 之间没有联系，而是有联系的。

input: But I think when you write the very famous celebrity equation e to the pi i equals negative 1, it heavily overstates the connection that there is between this e and that pi.
translatedText: 但我认为，当你将非常著名的名人方程 e 写到 pi i 等于负 1 时，它严重夸大了这个 e 和那个 pi 之间的联系。

input: What's really going on is that we have this function exp that we've defined, and that when you plug in real values, okay, when you plug in real numbers, for the reasons we talked about earlier, it makes sense to write exp of x in terms of whatever its value at 1 happens to be, exp of 1 raised to the x.
translatedText: 真正发生的事情是，我们定义了这个函数 exp，当你插入实数时，好吧，当你插入实数时，由于我们之前讨论 过的原因，将 exp 写成是有意义的x 无论其在 1 处的值是什么，1 的 exp 都会上升到 x。

input: And that we often call that value exp of 1 e, okay?
translatedText: 我们经常称之为 1 e 的值 exp，好吗？

input: This is a property of the function.
translatedText: 这是函数的一个属性。

input: Another fact about this is that when we plug in imaginary numbers, the claim of Euler's formula, which I haven't shown why it's true, but the claim that it's making is that it's periodic, basically.
translatedText: 关于这一点的另一个事实是，当我们插入虚数时，欧拉公式的主张，我 没有说明为什么它是正确的，但它所做的主张是它基本上是周期性的。

input: That it walks around a circle, and it's periodic with a period of 2 pi i.
translatedText: 它绕一圈走，并且具有周期性，周期为 2 pi i。

input: Basically when you increase that input by 2 pi i, you get back to where you started.
translatedText: 基本上，当您将该输入增加 2 pi i 时，您就会回到开始的位置。

input: And even more specifically that you do so by walking along a circle.
translatedText: 更具体地说，您可以通过绕圈行走来实现这一点。

input: So it's saying that each of these constants is a child of the function exp of x, right?
translatedText: 也就是说，每个常量都是 x 的函数 exp 的子函数，对吧？

input: But the way that they're related kind of happens along different dimensions.
translatedText: 但它们之间的关联方式是在不同的维度上发生的。

input: That I think is the healthy way to understand this formula.
translatedText: 我认为这是理解这个公式的健康方式。

input: Now in the next lecture, we are going to be talking about why this thing walks around in circles.
translatedText: 在下一讲中，我们将讨论为什么这个东西会绕圈子。

input: And that necessarily involves a little bit of calculus, so we're going to get a little bit of calculus into the mix here.
translatedText: 这必然涉及一点微积分，所以我们将在这里混合一点微积分。

input: But as minimal as I can.
translatedText: 但尽我所能。

input: And before then, I want to leave you with some homework.
translatedText: 在此之前，我想给你们留一些作业。

input: Because if you remember, the core property that related this strange polynomial with factorials to the number e, was that addition in the input is the same as multiplication in the output.
translatedText: 因为如果您还记得的话，将这个带有阶乘的奇怪多项式与数字 e 相关联的核心属性是输入中的加法与输出中的乘法相同。

input: So before next time, I won't grade this, this is just, you know, to do on your own time in your own way.
translatedText: 所以在下次之前，我不会给这个评分，这只是，你知道，用你自己的时间用你自己的方式来做。

input: Question number one, I want you to show that when you fully expand exp of x times exp of y, and you know, you might have written down for yourself what this function is, it's all those factorial things.
translatedText: 第一个问题，我想让你证明，当你完全展开 x 的 exp 乘以 y 的 e xp 时，你知道，你可能已经自己写下了这个函数是什么，它都是阶乘的东西。

input: Show that when you expand that out, each term has the form x to the k times y to the m divided by k factorial m factorial.
translatedText: 证明当你展开它时，每一项的形式都是 x 到 k 乘以 y 到 m 除以 k 阶乘 m 阶乘。

input: For certain whole numbers k and m.
translatedText: 对于某些整数 k 和 m。

input: And remember, zero factorial is defined to be one.
translatedText: 请记住，零阶乘被定义为一。

input: Question number two, show that when you expand exp of x plus y, so addition in the input, each term is going to look like one over n factorial times n choose k, times x to the k times y to the n minus k.
translatedText: 第二个问题，表明当您展开 x 加 y 的 exp 时，因此在输入中加法，每一项将看起来像 n 阶乘乘以 n 选择 k 的一分之一，乘以 x 乘以 k 乘以 y 乘以 n 减 k。

input: If you're not familiar with this term n choose k, take a look at the binomial formula, I'm sure there's plenty of excellent videos on YouTube about it, I'll leave links in the description as I find them.
translatedText: 如果您不熟悉这个术语 n 选择 k，请看一下二项式公式，我确信 You Tube 上有很多关于它的精彩视频，我会在找到它们时在说明中留下链接。

input: But show that that's true.
translatedText: 但要证明这是真的。

input: Question three, compare the two results that you just found to explain this key property.
translatedText: 问题三，比较您刚刚找到的两个结果来解释这个关键属性。

input: The thing that relates this function to some special constant and the idea of raising it to powers.
translatedText: 将该函数与某个特殊常数相关联的东西以及将其求幂的想法。

input: And then if you're up for the bonus question, this is for all of the extra credit in the world, justify, see if you can say, will this result still be true if x and y are complex numbers, and will it still be true if they're matrices?
translatedText: 然后，如果你要回答额外的问题，这是为了世界上所有的额外 学分，请证明，看看你是否可以说，如果 x 和 y 是复 数，这个结果仍然是正确的吗？ 如果它们是矩阵，则为真？

input: That actually I think is a very important exercise to go through to understand when this is true for what kinds of inputs.
translatedText: 实际上，我认为这是一个非常重要的练习，需要了解什么时候对于什么类型的输入来说这是正确的。

input: Because like I said, as you get deeper and deeper into math, this exp function remains very relevant and you start plugging in things that seem wilder and wilder.
translatedText: 因为就像我说的，随着你对数学越来越深入，这个 exp 函数仍然非常相关，你开始插入看起来越来越疯狂的东西。

input: It's useful, it is genuinely useful, and it's important to know what properties carry over and which ones don't.
translatedText: 它很有用，确实很有用，而且重要的是要知道哪些属性可以保留，哪些不能保留。

input: Now, I was talking a little about this lecture with a friend beforehand, and I mentioned the spirit of the lockdown math series being like high school classes.
translatedText: 现在，我事先和一位朋友谈论了这次讲座，我提 到了封锁数学系列的精神就像高中课程一样。

input: And you know, he looks at me quizzically and he's like, is this, is that a high school topic?
translatedText: 你知道，他疑惑地看着我，他说，这是、这是一个高中话题吗？

input: And the honest answer is I don't know.
translatedText: 诚实的答案是我不知道。

input: What I can say is that it is the case that in high school we came across the formula e to the i theta.
translatedText: 我能说的是，在高中时我们就遇到过 e 与 i theta 的公式。

input: I think the first time that I ever saw it, it was in learning about complex numbers.
translatedText: 我想我第一次看到它是在学习复数时。

input: It was just taught as the polar representation of complex numbers to emphasize this idea that when you multiply two things, you multiply their magnitudes and you add their angles.
translatedText: 它只是被教导为复数的极坐标表示，以强调这样一个想法：当 你将两个东西相乘时，你乘以它们的大小并添加它们的角度。

input: But it was just this strange thing handed from on high.
translatedText: 但这只是上头传来的奇怪之物。

input: The usual way that we teach a relationship between e to the x in this polynomial comes from a piece of calculus called Taylor series.
translatedText: 我们教授该多项式中 e 与 x 之间关系的常用方法来自称为泰勒级数的微积分。

input: And you start with the function e to the x, always defined in a little bit of a wishy-washy way, depending on the course that you're taking, and then you show that it's connected to this polynomial.
translatedText: 你从函数 e 到 x 开始，总是以一种有点软弱的方式定义， 具体取决于你正在学习的课程，然后你证明它与这个多项式有关。

input: But I think there's no reason we can't go the other way around.
translatedText: 但我认为我们没有理由不能反其道而行之。

input: And I actually wish that I had seen this.
translatedText: 我真的希望我能看到这个。

input: I wish that I had known from the beginning that through math, especially through deeper math, that this is what the expression e to the x actually means.
translatedText: 我希望我从一开始就知道通过数学，尤其是通 过更深层次的数学，这就是表达式 e 到 x 的实际含义。

input: So, with that I'm going to call an end to the proper lecture and just take a couple more questions from the audience to finish things off.
translatedText: 因此，我将结束这次正式的讲座，并回答听众的几个问题来结束整个演讲。

input: Maintain the inner activity that is the spirit of our lectures.
translatedText: 保持内在的活动，这就是我们讲座的精神。

input: Alright.
translatedText: 好吧。

input: Great, great, we have more discussion.
translatedText: 太好了，太好了，我们还有更多讨论。

input: I love this.
translatedText: 我喜欢这个。

input: Crispin's proof is wrong.
translatedText: 克里斯平的证明是错误的。

input: The constant function f of x equals zero.
translatedText: x 的常数函数 f 为零。

input: Ah, wonderful!
Excellent counter example.
translatedText: 啊，太棒了！ 优秀的反例。

input: I think this was maybe niggling in the back of my mind.
translatedText: 我想这可能是我内心深处的一个小问题。

input: It's like, I don't think this is unique.
translatedText: 就像，我不认为这是独一无二的。

input: Great.
translatedText: 伟大的。

input: So, you have the case of a function that is constantly equal to zero.
translatedText: 因此，您会遇到函数始终等于零的情况。

input: And I think, okay, whoever was asking a question earlier that I didn't quite understand, I think this must be what you were getting at, and I didn't, I just wasn't reading it properly.
translatedText: 我想，好吧，无论谁早些时候问了一个我不太明白的问题，我想这一定是你的意思，但我没有，我只是没有正确阅读它。

input: But yeah, that would be a function where f of zero is not necessarily one.
translatedText: 但是，是的，这将是一个函数，其中 f 为零不一定是一。

input: Beautiful!
translatedText: 美丽的！

input: Alright, so that question that I said was wrong and then I said it wasn't wrong, it actually was wrong.
translatedText: 好吧，所以我说的那个问题是错的，然后我说这不是错，实际上是错的。

input: So, thank you very much Eric Maas, and to everyone who can think more clearly about things than I can while live on camera.
translatedText: 所以，非常感谢埃里克·马斯（Eric Maas），也感谢所有在镜头前能够比我更清晰地思考问题的人。

input: And then another person points out exactly the same thing.
translatedText: 然后另一个人指出了完全相同的事情。

input: I love this!
translatedText: 我喜欢这个！

input: This is just like a real class.
translatedText: 这就像真正的课堂一样。

input: I'm up here, I get to make mistakes, you're down there, you get to correct them.
translatedText: 我在上面，我会犯错误，你在下面，你要纠正错误。

input: And I think it makes it better for everyone watching.
translatedText: 我认为这对每个观看的人来说都更好。

input: There's a legitimate discussion to be had.
translatedText: 需要进行合理的讨论。

input: What's relevant in the case of the exp function is just that it's not constantly zero, that it does in fact equal one at the input x equals zero.
translatedText: 与 exp 函数相关的是，它并不总是为零，事实上，当输入 x 等于 0 时，它确实等于 1。

input: But I love this discussion, and I think I can imagine no better place to end things than right there.
translatedText: 但我喜欢这个讨论，我想我想不出比这里更好的结束事情的地方了。

input: So, as always, thank you for joining.
translatedText: 所以，一如既往，感谢您的加入。

input: I hope this helped provide a little bit of a different perspective than what you usually see in other classes on what's a very popular topic on the internet.
translatedText: 我希望这有助于提供一些与您在其他课程中通常看到的有关互联网上非常流行的主题的不同视角。

input: At least as math goes.
translatedText: 至少在数学上是这样。

input: And next time we're going to talk about why it's true, where this circle would come from.
translatedText: 下次我们将讨论为什么这是真的，这个圆圈从何而来。

input: I hope to see you then.
translatedText: 我希望届时能见到你。
